Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת יִצְחָ֖ק בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
Translit: Ve'elleh toledot yitzchak ben-avraham avraham holid et-yitzchak.
English: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begat Isaac:

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יִצְחָק֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֶת־רִבְקָ֗ה בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י מִפַּדַּ֖ן אֲרָ֑ם אֲח֛וֹת לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translit: Vayhi yitzchak ben-arba'im shanah bekachto et-rivkah bat-betu'el ha'arammi mippaddan aram achot lavan ha'arammi lo le'ishah.
English: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padan-aram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.

Hebrew: וַיֶּעְתַּ֨ר יִצְחָ֤ק לַֽיהוָה֙ לְנֹ֣כַח אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ יְהוָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: Vayye'tar yitzchak ladonai lenochach ishto ki akarah hi vayye'ater lo adonai vattahar rivkah ishto.
English: And Isaac intreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

Hebrew: וַיִּתְרֹֽצֲצ֤וּ הַבָּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִם־כֵּ֔ן לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה אָנֹ֑כִי וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: Vayyitrotzatzu habbanim bekirbah vattomer im-ken lammah zeh anochi vattelech lidrosh et-adonai.
English: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה לָ֗הּ שְׁנֵ֤י גיים גוֹיִם֙ בְּבִטְנֵ֔ךְ וּשְׁנֵ֣י לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִמֵּעַ֖יִךְ יִפָּרֵ֑דוּ וּלְאֹם֙ מִלְאֹ֣ם יֶֽאֱמָ֔ץ וְרַ֖ב יַעֲבֹ֥ד צָעִֽיר׃
Translit: Vayyomer adonai lah shenei gym goyim bevitnech ushenei le'ummim mimme'ayich yipparedu ule'om mil'om ye'ematz verav ya'avod tza'ir.
English: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלְא֥וּ יָמֶ֖יהָ לָלֶ֑דֶת וְהִנֵּ֥ה תוֹמִ֖ם בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
Translit: Vayyimle'u yameiha laledet vehinneh tomim bevitnah.
English: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ אַדְמוֹנִ֔י כֻּלּ֖וֹ כְּאַדֶּ֣רֶת שֵׂעָ֑ר וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translit: Vayyetze harishon admoni kullo ke'adderet se'ar vayyikre'u shemo esav.
English: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.

Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן יָצָ֣א אָחִ֗יו וְיָד֤וֹ אֹחֶ֨זֶת֙ בַּעֲקֵ֣ב עֵשָׂ֔ו וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיִצְחָ֛ק בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּלֶ֥דֶת אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: Ve'acharei-chen yatza achiv veyado ochezet ba'akev esav vayyikra shemo ya'akov veyitzchak ben-shishim shanah beledet otam.
English: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.

Hebrew: וַֽיִּגְדְּלוּ֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ צַ֖יִד אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֶ֑ה וְיַעֲקֹב֙ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֔ם יֹשֵׁ֖ב אֹהָלִֽים׃
Translit: Vayyigdelu hanne'arim vayhi esav ish yodea' tzayid ish sadeh veya'akov ish tam yoshev ohalim.
English: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יִצְחָ֛ק אֶת־עֵשָׂ֖ו כִּי־צַ֣יִד בְּפִ֑יו וְרִבְקָ֖ה אֹהֶ֥בֶת אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translit: Vayye'ehav yitzchak et-esav ki-tzayid befiv verivkah ohevet et-ya'akov.
English: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥זֶד יַעֲקֹ֖ב נָזִ֑יד וַיָּבֹ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְה֥וּא עָיֵֽף׃
Translit: Vayyazed ya'akov nazid vayyavo esav min-hassadeh vehu ayef.
English: And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַלְעִיטֵ֤נִי נָא֙ מִן־הָאָדֹ֤ם הָאָדֹם֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י עָיֵ֖ף אָנֹ֑כִי עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translit: Vayyomer esav el-ya'akov hal'iteni na min-ha'adom ha'adom hazzeh ki ayef anochi al-ken kara-shemo edom.
English: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִכְרָ֥ה כַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־בְּכֹֽרָתְךָ֖ לִֽי׃
Translit: Vayyomer ya'akov michrah chayyom et-bechoratecha li.
English: And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לָמ֑וּת וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לִ֖י בְּכֹרָֽה׃
Translit: Vayyomer esav hinneh anochi holech lamut velammah-zeh li bechorah.
English: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ כַּיּ֔וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּמְכֹּ֥ר אֶת־בְּכֹרָת֖וֹ לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translit: Vayyomer ya'akov hishave'ah li kayyom vayyishava lo vayyimkor et-bechorato leya'akov.
English: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.

Hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֞ב נָתַ֣ן לְעֵשָׂ֗ו לֶ֚חֶם וּנְזִ֣יד עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖קָם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיִּ֥בֶז עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃
Translit: Veya'akov natan le'esav lechem unezid adashim vayyochal vayyeshet vayyakom vayyelach vayyivez esav et-habbechorah.
English: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִלְּבַד֙ הָרָעָ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בִּימֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ יִצְחָ֛ק אֶל־אֲבִימֶּ֥לֶךְ מֶֽלֶךְ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים גְּרָֽרָה׃
Translit: Vayhi ra'av ba'aretz millevad hara'av harishon asher hayah bimei avraham vayyelech yitzchak el-avimelech melech-pelishtim gerarah.
English: And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תֵּרֵ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה שְׁכֹ֣ן בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: Vayyera elav adonai vayyomer al-tered mitzrayemah shechon ba'aretz asher omar eleicha.
English: And the LORD appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:

Hebrew: גּ֚וּר בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶֽהְיֶ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ וַאֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֗ אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָֽאֲרָצֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל וַהֲקִֽמֹתִי֙ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translit: Gur ba'aretz hazzot ve'ehyeh immecha va'avarechekka ki-lecha ulezar'acha etten et-kol-ha'aratzot ha'el vahakimoti et-hashevu'ah asher nishba'ti le'avraham avicha.
English: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;

Hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְזַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֥ת כָּל־הָאֲרָצֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑ל וְהִתְבָּרֲכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: Vehirbeiti et-zar'acha kechochevei hashamayim venatatti lezar'acha et kol-ha'aratzot ha'el vehitbarachu vezar'acha kol goyei ha'aretz.
English: And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;

Hebrew: עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָהָ֖ם בְּקֹלִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמֹר֙ מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֔י מִצְוֺתַ֖י חֻקּוֹתַ֥י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
Translit: Ekev asher-shama avraham bekoli vayyishmor mishmarti mitzvotai chukkotai vetorotai.
English: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
